attributes.action: Put a price cap on further energy increases due in October
attributes.additional_details: The British people have recently seen a 54% increase in their gas and electric prices, sending some families into poverty. A further increase in October will see families more reliable on food banks and having to further choose heating or eating. A reintroduction of a benefit cap should be Introduced to stop families having to make severe choices
attributes.background: Stop further increases in gas and electric from october

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The energy cap is set by Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament. You can find out more about how the energy price cap is set here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/publications/price-cap-increase-ps693-april

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586
